newsitem.title: UK: NWE oil and gas drilling seen buoyant this year.
newsitem.headline: NWE oil and gas drilling seen buoyant this year.

text.p: Oil and gas exploration and appraisal drilling in northwest Europe (NWE) this year is expected to rise for the fourth year in succession, consultancy Arthur Andersen said.
Andersen said it expected 212 new wells to be drilled in Britain, Norway, the Netherlands, Ireland and Denmark in 1997 from 180 last year and 164 in 1995.
"Drilling levels have risen for the last three years and the forecast looks good," said Andersen analyst Rebecca Gregory.
UK drilling is expected to rise to 115 wells from 103 last year and 98 in 1995.
Norwegian activity is expected to remain constant at 35 wells from 33 last year and 36 in 1995.
Dutch drilling is forecast at 46 wells from 36 in 1996 and 12 in 1995.
Ireland is expected to start seven wells this year and Denmark nine, both almost double last year.
